title: AP® Statistics 2021: Exploring Data
driving_question: How can we use the five-number summary and outlier detection methods to analyze a dataset?

tasks.task_description: Provide the five-number summary (minimum, lower quartile, median, upper quartile, and maximum) of the distribution of length of stay.
Identify the outliers in the dataset using two methods: Method A (1.5 IQR rule) and Method B (2 standard deviations rule).

pre_thinking_prompts: What is the five-number summary and how can it help in understanding a dataset?
What are outliers and why are they important in data analysis?
What are the two methods for detecting outliers and how do they work?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on the process of analyzing the dataset using the five-number summary and outlier detection methods. What insights were you able to gain about the data?
ai_tutor_prompts: Remember to label all five statistics in your five-number summary.
Ensure you calculate the lower and upper outlier criteria correctly for both methods.
Don't forget to identify the specific outliers based on your calculations.
remix_zone: Consider exploring other statistical measures such as the mean, standard deviation, and interquartile range (IQR). How do these measures add to your understanding of the dataset?
